articles.title: 'My Kaali is queer': Leena Manimekalai amid controversy over film poster
articles.description: Leena Manimekalai who identifies herself as bisexual and atheist said in her film Goddess Kaali inhabits in her body and wanders the city streets. "My Kaali is queer. She is a free spirit. She spits at the patriarchy. She dismantles Hindutva. She destroys cap…

articles.title: 15 Dead, Over 40 Missing After Cloudburst Near Amarnath Shrine: 10 Facts
articles.description: Fifteen people were killed and more than 40 are reported missing after a cloudburst near the holy cave shrine of Amarnath in Jammu and Kashmir on Friday, said officials. The yatra has been suspended till further notice.
articles.content:
• The cloudburst was reported at around 5:30 pm.Community kitchens and tents near the cave shrine were washed away.

articles.title: Chinese Fighter Jet Flew Close To LAC In Ladakh, India Responded: Report
articles.description: A Chinese Air Force aircraft flew very close to a friction point in the eastern Ladakh sector on the Line of Actual Control in the last week of June, after which the Indian Air Force responded swiftly as per standard operating procedures.
articles.content:
Indian Air Force responded swiftly as per standard operating procedures. (Representational)

articles.title: 1-day mourning in India, US 'outraged': How the world reacted to ex-Japan PM Shinzo Abe's assassination
articles.description: The assassination of former Japanese PM Shinzo Abe left the world leaders in shock. They mourned the death of their “friend” and remembered him for his contribution to elevating bilateral relations.
articles.content:
Condolences poured in from across the world after Shinzo Abe, the longest-serving Japanese PM, was shot dead during a campaign speech in Japans Nara on Friday.

articles.title: Phones seized in spy probe, charges of ‘immoral’ conduct, 4 Army officers move SC over privacy
articles.description: The four officers have claimed that their mobile phones and other personal digital assets were seized by Army authorities in March on the directions of Directorate General of Military Intelligence (DGMI).

articles.title: Maharashtra politics: SC to hear Uddhav Thackeray faction's plea challenging governor's decision on July 11
